alert.note: Alert for Eastern Loudoun; Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 8:35PM EST until further notice by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Goose Creek near Leesburg affecting Eastern Loudoun and Western Loudoun zones. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Goose Creek near Leesburg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The creek overflows its banks near Oatlands, south of Leesburg. Backwater flooding begins to affect a low spot on State Route 650, Oatlands Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.2 feet, or 4.8 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1AM 7AM 1PM Stg Time Date Goose Creek Leesburg 12.0 7.2 Tue 7 pm 11.2 11.2 7.6 11.8 4am Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EST.
